IThere was general agreement that the .Governmentshould confirm their intention of giving effect toresolutions of the Imperial economic Conference and the pledges given in the General election but should statethat the precise method of giving effect to the advantagesoffered to the Dominions and the Colonies by the prefer-ential treatment of canned fish, apples and currants wasbeing examined and that definite proposals would be madeon the introduction of the Budget.The Committee were agreed:-(a) That the Resolutions of the Imperial Economic Conference should be carried out except as regards canned fish, apples and currants,(b) That the method of bounties did not offer. a satisfactory method of dealing with these commodities.(c) That the proposals for developing the marketing of Imperial products outlined to the Committee by the President of the Board of Trade should be further examined by the Interdepartmental Committee with a view to putting definite proposals before the Imperial Economic Committee,it being understood that the Chancellor of the Exchequer was prepared to provide a sum equivalent to what a bounty on Empire apples canned fish and currants would, have cost the Treasury.HOTS.
